posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
If you play online games, you most certainly have met him already. If not, you are bound to sooner or later. (I would say sooner). I am talking about the annoying little bastard called

THE EPIC MUNCHKIN

He is of course a Gnome.
Small and weak, immature and lacking basic social skills.
His assets are his brilliant intellect and his constitution (despite severe lack of physical exercise). This makes him extremely inventive and hard to kill.

He is of course a wizard (favored class and everything), and it fits his abilities superbly.
However, he has a greater dream! He wants to become a sword master, the ultimate “Frag Man”. He follows that dream with great determination and imagination until he finally reaches his peak at level 40.
On his travels his companion, a Dragon called “Tuff”, follows him. (To everyone else it is a fairy dragon, but the little gnome sees things differently.)

Stats:
Strength: Average for a gnome - 9
Dexterity: Nothing special, but a small bonus for his keyboard and gamepad handling - 11
Constitution: Gnomish endurance - 17
Wisdom: Immature and narrow minded - 8
Intelligence: He handles the meta-abstract very well and can explain the pros and cons of the current programming of the latest video card drivers - 18
Charisma: Annoying and lacking basic social skills - 8

Feats:
He takes combat feats as his general feats and metamagic as bonus feats:

Skills:
His high intelligence enables a large number of skills. He knows everything about computer programming and thinks he knows a lot about medieval weaponry. This gives him a high lore skill so he can identify any über items on the spot.
He can also craft weapons and enchant them with his magic so he can sell loads of magically enhanced swords until he has enough gold to buy more über items.
The skill selection further supports the idea of a mage striving to become a sword master:
Concentration 43(49), Craft Weapon 13(20), Discipline 28(38), Heal 43(42), Intimidate 4(3), Lore 43(50), Spellcraft 43(50), Taunt 16(15), Tumble 20(21)

Alignment:
He will probably pretend to be good - or more likely - dressed in black and evil, but judged from his actions he is a typical Chaotic Neutral.

Spells:
Early in his career, he discovered some old transmuter tomes. He read with great interest how Tenser’s magic could transform himself into a longsword wielding fighter. He understood how this would support his sword master prowess even in transformed state! Ever after, he has used that spell to improve his fighter abilities whenever needed (always).

Spells lvl 1 – 5: Sword enhancing spells, buffs and utility spells
Spells lvl 6: Tenser’s and buffs
Spells lvl 7: Extended Tenser’s and buffs
Spells lvl 8: Empowered Tenser’s and buffs
Spells lvl 9: Maximized Tenser’s and support spells

Beware! 
If you ever become harassed by this heavily buffed Doom knight/ sword master, performing Whirlwind attacks flanked by a Red Dragon and a Fairy Dragon, you know who that b*st*rd is!
Unbuffed and with a mundane longsword he has only AC 18, AB +27/+22/+17, damage 1-8 (crit: 15-20/x3), 362 HP and fort, refl and will saves all +20.
However, with maximized Tenser’s and buffs, it can reach (approximately) AC50, AB +53/+48/+43, damage 1-8 +8 (15-20/x3) +1d6 fire +3physical and have more than 600 HP.
